briefTitle: Efficacy of Extended Release Tramadol for Treating Prescription Opioid Withdrawal

interventions.name: Placebo
otherNames: Placebo is like a sugar pill

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Addicted to opioids

Exclusion Criteria:

* Any major medical or psychiatric disorder that would be contraindicated for participation

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjective Opioid Withdrawal Total Adjective Score
outcomeMeasures.description: range of scores is 0-84; low scores indicate no opioid withdrawal, higher scores indicating more opioid withdrawal present. T

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Number of Breakthrough Withdrawal Medication Doses Taken Week 1
outcomeMeasures.description: There were four medications (acetaminophen for aches/pains, zolpidem for trouble sleeping, bismuth subsalicylate for diarrhea, and alumina/magnesia/simethicone for nausea/upset stomach) available to all volunteers in all treatment arms to help relieve any withdrawal symptoms that were not relieved by the blinded tramadol/placebo doses.

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjective Opioid Withdrawal Adjective Total Score Week 2
outcomeMeasures.description: range of scores is 0-84; low scores indicate no opioid withdrawal, higher scores indicating more opioid withdrawal present

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Number of Breakthrough Withdrawal Medication Doses Taken Week 2
outcomeMeasures.description: There were four medications (acetaminophen for aches/pains, zolpidem for trouble sleeping, bismuth subsalicylate for diarrhea, and alumina/magnesia/simethicone for nausea/upset stomach) available to all volunteers in all treatment arms to help relieve any withdrawal symptoms that were not relieved by the blinded tramadol/placebo doses.
